newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil real ends up 0.02 pct in nervous trading.
newsitem.headline: Brazil real ends up 0.02 pct in nervous trading.

text.p: Brazil's real ended up 0.02 percent to end at 1.0145 per dollar in the commercial foreign exchange market amid nervous trading due to a lack of liquidity in late afternoon, dealers said.

The lack of liquidity was triggered by outflows in commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts. Preliminary figures showed a Thursday deficit of around $30 million in late afternoon, they added.
In the interbank floating rate market, the real fell 0.01 percent to end at 1.0191 to the dollar.
In the illegal parallel market, the real close at 1.034 per greenback, up 0.10 percent.
